Title: Insecurity: Edo police redeploy Ekpoma DPO
Summary: CSP Tomofe Nwabueze is the new DPO for Ekpoma . The Edo State Police Command has confirmed the move . The DPO was the Divisional Police Officer (DPO)

Title: Senator Natasha slams arrest of 52 AAU students, seeks release
Summary: Senator Natasha Akpoti-Uduaghan has condemned the arrest and alleged unlawful detention of 52 students of Ambrose Alli University (AAU) She described the action as a troubling assault on democratic expression and youth participation in governance .

Title: Alumnus gifts UI research facility, offers scholarships
Summary: The University of Ibadan has signed a Deed of Gift for the donation of a research facility and a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for the institution of a scholarship scheme and an annual lecture series with International Energy Services Limited .

Title: OOUTH denies imposing unprofessional duties on nurses
Summary: Olabisi Onabanjo University Teaching Hospital (OOUTH), Sagamu, denies imposing unprofessional duties on nurses . Management of the hospital denies allegations that it compelled its nurses to carry out cleaning duties due to the ongoing Joint Health Sector Union (JOHESU) strike .

Title: Lucia Onabanjo, wife of first Ogun civilian governor, dies at 100
Summary: Chief (Mrs) Lucia Onabowale Onabanjo, wife of the first civilian Governor of Ogun State, died at 100 . Chief Victor Olabisi Onbanjo has passed away at the age of 100 .

Title: Portable arraigned in court over nine-count criminal charges, remanded in custody
Summary: Controversial singer Habeeb Okikiola, popularly known as Portable, was arraigned before the Federal High Court in Ota, Ogun State . He was remanded in custody over nine-count criminal charges .

Title: Turji’s fresh threat empties villages, rekindles fear in Sokoto
Summary: Turji warns of 'dire consequences' for Tidibale and nearby settlements that have not aligned with him . Local accounts suggest that Turji is attempting to reassert relevance and recognition after a lull in his activities .

Title: Freezing rain paralyses transport in Central Europe
Summary: Freezing rain led to flights being suspended at Vienna airport on Tuesday . Slovakia, Czech Republic and Hungary also experienced travel disruptions . The freezing rain paralyses transport in Central Europe .

Title: AFCON ’25: Osimhen to captain Super Eagles against Morocco
Summary: Victor Osimhen will wear the captain's armband for the Super Eagles in their semi-final clash against Morocco’s Atlas Lions .

Title: Mama Onabanjo’s death ends glorious era – Abiodun
Summary: Abiodun said the loss of a mother is always painful, regardless of age . He said the transition at 101 is also worthy of celebration, given her impactful life and enduring legacy .
